page.title: 13LOCAL ISSUES IN BICESTER
page.content: Over the past year there has been concern about the integration of American personnel in the town.300 more houses are due to be built at Caversfield.Local residents are worried that house prices will depreciate.They are not allowed to use American facilities. THE M40:The plans for the M40 have finally been passed, much to the elief of people living in Bicester.It is hoped this will take some of the heavy traffic out of the town centre and bring more jobs to the area. OPEN SPACES:The local paper,the 'Bicester Advertiser',has featured many letters about the lack of open spaces in the town.Plans have been mooted to build on large playing fields behind Bicester School and Longfields.People are angry that they will have nowhere to their dogs.
